explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA Rule 2.2 forbids dead code defined as an operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour. In the provided configuration mhd_assert is defined as ((void)0). That expands to a null expression statement that produces no runtime effect and—more importantly—does not generate an executed operation in the generated code. Thus there is no executed operation here that could be removed without changing behaviour; the call is compiled out (and/or is a deliberate no-op used for alternate build configurations). Also, whether an assert call is a no-op depends on the build-time definition of the macro; its presence in source may be meaningful in other configurations. For these reasons the assertion-call instances shown do not constitute dead code under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 in the given configuration.
